members.signatureBeforeChange: int kEventControlContextualMenuClick (int nextHandler, int theEvent, int userData)
members.signatureAfterChange: int kEventControlContextualMenuClick (int nextHandler, int theEvent, int userData)
diff: -	OS.GetEventParameter (theEvent, OS.kEventParamMouseLocation, OS.typeQDPoint, null, sizeof, null, pt);
+		OS.GetEventParameter (theEvent, OS.kEventParamWindowMouseLocation, OS.typeHIPoint, null, CGPoint.sizeof, null, pt);
+		OS.GetEventParameter (theEvent, OS.kEventParamMouseLocation, OS.typeQDPoint, null, sizeof, null, pt);

members.signatureBeforeChange: int helpProc (int inControl, int inGlobalMouse, int inRequest, int outContentProvided, int ioHelpContent)
members.signatureAfterChange: int helpProc (int inControl, int inGlobalMouse, int inRequest, int outContentProvided, int ioHelpContent)
diff: +			* If a control doesn't have a tooltip text, then helpProc gets
+			* called on the controls in its parent hierarchy and their
+			* tooltip text is used. Note that returning OS.eventNotHandledErr
+			* prevents the window help content callback from being called. The fix
+			* is to only handle the message when the cursor is directly over this
-				 * If a control doesn't have a tooltiptext, then helpProc gets
-				 * called on the controls in its parent hierarchy and their
-				 * tooltiptext is used. Return OS.eventNotHandledErr to prevent
-				 * the calls on the parent control.
